result.execSummary:
The defendant Anna C Bowler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Avoid Penalty, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Probation may transfer to Broward County Florida.

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution in the amount of $6,000.00 and restitution surcharge.

Pay court costs.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
-------------------------------

No alcohol.   No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.   Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. No bars or liquor stores.  No contact with victim without victim's and probation agent's consent. 
-------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.   Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.   The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
-------------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
-------------------------------

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anna C Bowler

records.addlTxt: Probation extended 2 years ; new discharge date 4/29/21 or until court costs and restitution paid in full (ko)

9:31m  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
DA Zeke S Wiedenfeld appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Probation Agent Julie Braunreiter.  
Defendant Anna C Bowler appeared.     
Matter is on for a probation review hearing.  There has only been one payment of $50 made by defendant.  Defendant states she is low income and is struggling.  She makes $8.00 per hour doing clerical work.  She has an oldest child that she sent to college last year.  Deft completed 2 years of treatment in Florida.  Then she returned to Wisconsin to address her charges here.  She has maintained 5 years of sobriety.  She has reestablished the relationship with the victim, her sister.  She is just trying to get back on her feet.  She currently has debt to State of Wisconsin of 2nd OWI and is on a payment plan.  she is requesting a civil judgment in this case and hoping to set up another payment plan.  She does receive food stamps and daycare assistance.  9:37 am  Response by Atty Wiedenfeld.  He does not believe there has been a good faith effort and proposes a 2 year extension of probation so she can pay the restitution.  Mr. Bowler says with an extension of probation, she would incur additional supervision fees.  Ms. Braunreiter says the position of DOC is that she has not made a good faith effort.  Court will extend probation for 2 years.  It can be eliminated if she pays it in full or victim agrees to end the debt.  Court responds to Ms. Bowler's questions.  9:42 am  Court in recess.
Probation review hearing on April 17, 2019 at 09:30 am.

records.addlTxt: BOND QUASHED
Defendant Anna C Bowler in court with attorney David A Danz.  Andrew Robert Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.

10:23 am  Court in session.  Case Called.  Appearances given.   
Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Anna C Bowler in court with attorney David A Danz. 
Matter was before the Court for sentencing on file 2015CF000005 and plea and sentencing on file 2014CT000364
Atty Danz advises that they have an agreement.  
Attys inform the Court that there are prerequisites to the agreement - things that the defense needs to take care of before proceeding to sentencing.  
Attys estimate needing approximate 30 days.  
The prerequisites involve having traffic citations removed from the CCAP Court record.  
Discussion as to whether this can be accomplished in 30 days.  
Court indicates that if a reasonable request is made to reset the new date, the Court will consider rescheduling.  
10:27 am  Atty Danz makes a record as to his discussions with his client concerning this agreement. 
10:28 am  Court in recess.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 15, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Defendant's Sentencing Memorandum prepared by Lisa Andreas, M.S.W.
Order for Defendant's Appearance at Department of Corrections for Pre-Sentence Investigation Report

Defendant Anna C Bowler, appears by telephone, with attorney David A Danz.  Andrew Robert Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Danz explains that the previously assigned DA on this case withdrew and it was reassigned to another DA in the office.  A new offer has been made on the felony case.  Attorney Danz expects to be able to set up a plea and sentencing date in October.  Court will schedule this case for Jury trial.  Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 10, 2015 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for December 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
